availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Joseph E. Brown (Milledgeville, Baldwin County, Georgia, attorney and governor of Georgia)

body.p: Milledgeville, Baldwin County, Georgia, attorney and governor of Georgia. South Carolina native. Married to Elizabeth Brown. Father of Julius Brown, Mary Brown, Joseph brown, Frank Brown, Elizabeth Brown, and Charles J. Brown. Attended Yale Law School. Member of the Senate of the state of Georgia in 1849 as a member of the Democratic Party. Attorney in Cherokee County, Georgia in 1850. Owned five enslaved persons in Cherokee County, Georgia in 1850. Attorney in Milledgeville, Georgia in 1860. Owned sixteen enslaved persons in Cherokee County, Georgia in 1860. Governor of Georgia from 1857 to 1865.
